Transcript: Lucy: Ok, then. Rise and shine. Up.
Paige: Lucy, what?
Lucy: Up. Up, up, up. Get up.
Paige: Where's Kevin?

Lucy: He -- let's see. Where did he go? He ran out of teal -- or was it that 
angel glow white color? So he had to go. Let's go. Come on.

Paige: Go where? I'm not leaving before Kevin's finished painting the 
portrait.

Lucy: Well, I don't really mean "let's go," let's go. I mean let's really, 
truly leave.
Paige: I can't be the only one who has difficulty understanding you.
Lucy: Ok, look. I just found out that you are an angel, right?
Paige: Yeah, so far.

Lucy: And supposedly you're on some sort of quest or journey or something 
that you claim you don't understand.
Paige: "Claim?"

Lucy: Yeah. So as soon as we figure out why you're here, then I figure you're 
going to be gone. Which means instead of you sitting around just waiting for my 
husband to finish your portrait and not caring what happens, I happen to really 
care. So I want to figure this out. Let's get to work.
Paige: On what?
Lucy: Figuring out why you're here and where you need to go.

Paige: Lucy, you don't honestly think that those ridiculous cards can tell 
the future.
Lucy: Paige, I do, so shut up and shuffle.
Casey: Ricky -- Ricky, it's me --
Jamal: Yo.
Casey: Jamal and Frank.
Jamal: Ricky --
Frank: Ricky?
Casey: See, I told you -- he might have already split town by now.
Frank: In the condition you say he was in, Casey?
Casey: Fine. So he disappeared into thin air, ok, Frank?

Jamal: Yeah, well, speaking of disappearing, where did you disappear to while 
we were out searching the docks?
Casey: I had to hit the john. Is that all right with you, Daddy?

Frank: Look, look, he's not here. Let's grab a quick bite at the Recovery 
Room and then head back out, ok?
Jamal: Yeah, that sounds like a plan to me.
Frank: All right. Let's roll.
Casey: That's cool. So I'll see you all later.
Jamal: What, you're not coming with us?
Casey: Man, actually, I'm kind of not feeling all that great, so --
Jamal: Oh, all of a sudden?

Casey: Yeah, it happens. Look, I'm just going to chill and hang out, all 
right? I'll catch up.
Frank: Are you sure you're ok?

Casey: It's minor, all right? Just -- just -- you two keep looking for him, 
ok?
Frank: Ok, if you say so. Jamal.
Jamal: Uh-huh. Yeah.
Casey: Ok. They're gone. Come out, come out, wherever you are.
[Ricky coughs]
Casey: Ricky. You look like hell.
Alison: Ok. So wait -- you have the blanket, you have the CDs --
Rafe: Yeah.
Alison: You have the basket. Ok.
Rafe: Right here. Got it all.

Alison: Ok, good. So we're just going to go in and enjoy a nice, quiet, calm, 
"everything's fine, we're just going to enjoy every single last minute that we 
have together" romantic picnic.
Rafe: In our special place.

Alison: That's right, in our very special place where all of our good dreams 
come true. I'm just trying to erase that terrible dream that you had about --
Rafe: Angel, please, not another word about, you know --
Alison: Oh, you mean about me being the fifth chair.
Rafe: Alison --

Alison: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, ok? Listen to me. I'm very sorry. But I'm 
happy. I'm healthy. Look at me. Everything's fine, ok? And I'm in love 
with you. So let's go in and enjoy some of our time together.

Rafe: Ok. You're right. I know you're right. I mean, like I say, life is a 
gift and it's precious --
Alison: That's right.
Rafe: And while things are going our way, we should just --
Girl: All right, both of you --
Boy: Hold it right there.
Rafe: What the --
Girl: Don't move a muscle.
Boy: I know how to use this, so don't get any ideas, ok?
[Captioning made possible by ABC, Inc., and SOAPnet]

Casey: Ok. Ok. I zapped some soup from the fridge and I grabbed some stuff 
for your face, so --
Ricky: Not hungry.
Casey: Look, you're shivering, ok? Come on. This'll help warm you up.
Ricky: Hot enough.
Casey: Look, man, I'm just trying to help!
Ricky: I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

Casey: Yeah. Me, too. Ok, look, Ricky, I'm not used to helping anybody, ok? 
This is kind of new to me. I don't really know how to do this, so -- hey. Wow. 
Oh, man, you are hot. Look, are you sure this is the right thing? Ricky, you 
sure this is the right thing, us staying down here?
Ricky: Got to stay. You promised, case. Can't go back to jail.
[Ricky coughs]
Casey: Wait, wait, you -- you promised, too, ok? No dying on me.
Ricky: Deal.
Casey: Ok, so you just chill and -- I'm going to help.
[Ricky coughs]
Ricky: No, no -- don't touch it. I don't want you to --

Casey: Look, it's me. Ricky, it's me. Ok, I've seen worse, all right? Ok, 
just -- please, let me do what I can.
Ricky: Ok.
Casey: Just lay still, all right? Don't move. I'm just going to --
[Ricky groans]
Casey: Oh.
Ricky: What?
Casey: Hey. It's not too bad. I'd tell you, right?
Ricky: Yeah. Tell me the truth.

Casey: Ok. The truth? The truth is you have a fever, ok? And -- and the cuts 
and stuff on your face -- look, Ricky, you're burning up, ok? We got to do 
something! We can't just --
Ricky: Just leave it. It doesn't matter, Gigi.
Casey: What did you say?
Ricky: Doesn't matter.

Casey: No, no -- no, you said, "Gigi." Gi -- that's your sister, Gabriela. 
That's what you call her.
Ricky: Doesn't matter. My whole family --
Casey: No, no, no --
Ricky: I never mattered.

Casey: No, Ricky -- ok, that's not true! Ricky. No. Ricky, what are you 
doing? Ricky, wake up! No, come on! Ricky!
Rafe: Ok, I said take it easy.

Boy: And I said to get lost, mister. You can go back to my parents and tell 
them I'm not coming home and I'm not moving.
Girl: That goes for me, too.
Rafe: Kids, you need to calm down.
Boy: We're not kids.

Alison: Oh, no. Of course they're not. God, Rafe, they're almost teenagers. 
And they're armed -- or he's armed with a very dangerous pitchfork.
Rafe: Right.
Alison: Right.

Rafe: Ok. You know what? Nobody sent us and we don't know your parents, so, 
you know, put the fork down.

Alison: Yeah. I mean, if you guys just sort of tell us what's wrong, then 
maybe we could help you.
Boy: Yeah, right.
Girl: Bernie?
Bernie: Ok. What are you doing here?
Girl: This is our place, you know.
Alison: I'm sorry. It's actually our place, too.
Bernie: Yeah?
Rafe: Yeah. It is, so -- yeah -- that kind of gives us something in common.
Alison: Yeah. So, what is going on here? Why are you guys so upset?
Bernie: I'm not going. That's what's going on. I'm not afraid.
Girl: His family's moving.
Bernie: But no one can make me go.
Girl: We grew up next door to each other our whole lives.

Bernie: We're best friends, and someday we thought we'd be kind of -- you 
know.
Girl: Together.

Bernie: And if they think we're moving, we're not going to get to see each 
other again for long time.
Girl: Uh-uh. No way.

Alison: Ok, ok, I understand. Ok, but, you know, you guys, there's lots of 
things that you can do to stay connected even if you're not together.
Bernie: Yeah, that's what they say, too.

Girl: You just don't understand what it's like to have your best friend leave 
you forever.
Alison: Actually, sweetie --
Rafe: Actually, yeah, we do.
Paige: Lucy, you're out of your mind if you actually think that these --

Lucy: Oh, no, no, no, I don't just think. I know these cards can tell you 
what the universe has in store, what it has planned, even for someone who's 
crossed over to the big side.
Paige: Yes, but I don't believe in these kind of --

Lucy: Well, just -- would you just shuffle? I cannot believe this. I am 
sitting here talking to a dead person, and you say you can't believe in this?

Paige: Well, I can believe in angels because I have evidence. I mean, I am 
evidence. But, I mean, to think turning over a silly card can tell the future --

Lucy: It can -- the future, the past, and anything else that's in store for 
you. Now, you just have to be very sensitive to the symbols on the cards, and I 
happen to be very, very darn sensitive. So just please keep shuffling and focus.
Paige: On what?

Lucy: Focus on what you're most desperate to know. I'll tell you what I'm 
most desperate to know is why you're here. I'm sure you're anxious also.
Paige: Right. Well, it's obviously no use arguing.
Lucy: Right.
Paige: There you are. Shuffled sufficiently. What's next?
Lucy: Ok -- well, you did that very nicely.
Paige: Hmm.
Lucy: Cut the cards. Oh, very nice job. Let's see what we have, shall we?
Paige: What? What is it?
Lucy: Oh, my goodness. Look at it. Look.
Paige: And?

Lucy: It's the Angel card. It's staring right up at you. Don't you see? What 
do you think?
Paige: Coincidence?
Lucy: No. Think again. All right. Let's see.
[Lucy gasps]
Paige: What? What is it?
Lucy: I don't know. I'm not really sure what that means.
Paige: What what means? What is it?

Lucy: Well, that's kind of a good question. I mean, my dumb cards came up 
with the angel staring at us right away, right? But this I don't know.
Paige: It's a young girl.

Lucy: Yes. But the question is, what connection does she have to you and why 
you're here?
Frank: I just hope you're learning a couple things from all this, Jamal.
Jamal: Oh, God, I feel a lecture coming on.
Frank: Look, just sit down --

Jamal: No, why don't you sit down? What do you mean about learn something 
from this?
Frank: Would you stop giving me a hard time when I'm trying to help?

Jamal: Look, well, your helping is ticking me off. Besides, Ricky is the one 
that needs help, not me.
Frank: Ricky got cut by those guys in that back alley crap game, right?
Jamal: Yeah. So what?

Frank: So you were there, too, Jamal. And from the size of that chip on your 
shoulder, you're lucky those guys didn't try to cut you up.
Jamal: Or maybe they're lucky that they didn't try.

Frank: Right. You would have driven them away with your attitude and your new 
and improved personality -- same thing you've been using to drive away most of 
your friends.
Jamal: Well, maybe they weren't friends to begin with anyway.

Frank: So what are you going to do now, huh? Chase those guys down by 
yourself for some kind of payback?

Jamal: I know what I'm doing, Frank. I'm just doing what I got to do, just 
like everybody else.

Frank: You know what? You're going to end up ratcheting this thing up and 
getting yourself killed.

Jamal: Look, Frank, you want to sweat it about somebody getting killed, 
that's your thing.
Casey: Frank! Jamal!
Jamal: What?
Casey: Hurry!
Frank: What's going on?
Casey: It's Ricky!
Frank: You found him?
Jamal: Where is he? Where is he?
Casey: He's at our place. He -- he passed out. I couldn't wake him up!

Lucy: This person is connected to you somehow, but the question is, who is 
that?
Paige: But I don't know any young girl. I mean --

Lucy: Right, right. Maybe not, maybe not. Maybe you don't even realize you 
know her. You know what? Let's turn over another card, shall we? Oh. Ha-ha. Look 
at that.
Paige: "Ha-ha" what?

Lucy: Journey's end. Journey's end. Somehow this young girl is connected to 
your journey's end. It's as clear as day.

Paige: Oh, I wish it were. Honestly, I wish I could see what you do, Lucy, 
but I --

Lucy: Well, you might be able to, Paige, if you would just open up your brain 
and try to focus here, ok? I'm going to do another one. Family. This is family. 
Wait -- something about your family.

Paige: Well, that proves it, then. I mean, they're wrong or you're wrong 
because I don't have any family. I was the last one.

Lucy: No. No, no, no. That's not right at all. This is right. Paige, you're 
not the last one. This is telling me that you do have a family and you're not 
the last one of your line.
Alison: You know, I lost my best friend one time, too.
Girl: Just like that?
Alison: Yeah, just like that. Just gone.
Bernie: And there wasn't anything you could do?
Alison: No, not to stop it. No --
Girl: Bernie. He's Bernie.
Bernie: She's Sara.
Alison: Oh.
Rafe: Bernie and Sara.
Alison: Hmm.
Sara: You're really not making it up?

Alison: Oh, no, no, no, no. No, I -- I really felt like I was going to die, 
and I -- I felt this terrible emptiness in me. I was really sort of afraid that 
maybe he might forget about me, you know?
Rafe: But he didn't. He never could.
Alison: No. And then I remembered something that he told me before he left.
Sara: What?
Alison: He told me that we'd never be more than a thought away.
Bernie: That really couldn't help me.
Alison: No, but it -- I mean, it helped me. It could.
Sara: How?

Rafe: Well, because she knows that whenever she thought of him, he would have 
her in his thoughts, too, and in his heart -- always.
Bernie: Even if they were far apart?
Sara: Even if they didn't see each other for years and years?

Alison: And who knows? You know, maybe you guys could, like, end up back here 
together someday, you know?
Rafe: No matter how far apart they might be for a while.
Alison: Yeah. Because that's what true love is all about.
Sara: I wish I could believe that's true.

Rafe: You know, this place is special for all of us, so why don't we do 
something to make it officially special.
Alison: Yeah, yeah, a place where all good dreams come true.
Bernie: Like what?

Rafe: It's funny you should ask. Follow me. Come here. See, now, what we're 
going to do is carve our names here so anyone who comes in here in, say, 20 
years or 50 years or even, like, 100 years will know that you were together. 
Right?
Alison: Hmm.
Rafe: And they'll always know that you two were in each other's hearts. So --
Alison: Oh. Look, here's a knife. You can use this one. Yeah.
Rafe: Want to go first?
Sara: Sure. Why not?
Bernie: I'll help, Sara.
Frank: Ricky?
Jamal: Ricky.
Casey: Help's here, Ricky.
Frank: Come on, Ricky. Open those eyes.
Jamal: Yeah, come on. Start shooting off that mouth of yours, Garza. Come on.
Casey: Is he ok, Frank?

Frank: He's not even close to ok. He's in bad shape. His fever's high. He's 
probably septic. Why didn't you get some help right away?

Casey: Well, because he didn't want me to go and get help because he thought 
he might go to prison!
Jamal: Yeah, right, so -- but you can help now, right, Casey?
Casey: Look, just help him, ok?

Frank: Ok, he needs a full-fledged M.D. We need to get him out of here and to 
the hospital.
Jamal: All right, I'm with you, I'm with you.
Frank: Come on.
Jamal: Yeah, but he's going to be ok, right, in the end?
Casey: Don't say "end," Jamal, ok? Don't even think that.
Frank: Let's go. He's in bad shape. That's all I know. Come on.
Jamal: Go upstairs.

Casey: Please don't let me be right. Please, God? Don't let me be right. I 
remember, I remember, and so I push him away because I didn't want him to get 
too close because then he might end up in the fifth chair. And then I know what 
Ed said, Rafe. I know what Ed said. So I don't want him to have this death 
sentence because, you know, we sleep together. No. Not you, Ricky. Please don't 
be the one who dies.

Paige: Look, keeping an open mind's one thing, but how can I when I know for 
a fact that I am all alone in the world? I mean, parents, brothers, sisters, 
aunts, cousins, uncles -- all of it, gone, whether it's from hard living or old 
age or, well, accidents, as in my case.

Lucy: Yeah. Sorry about that. Listen, you may know what you know, but the 
cards know things that we don't even know --
Paige: No --
Lucy: And they never lie.
Paige: Lucy, it's impossible.

Lucy: It's -- nothing, nothing is impossible, believe me, in this universe. 
I've seen vampires and now angels and people who think they don't have family 
but they really do have family. Come on. Bear with me here, Paige. Just -- why 
don't you turn over three more cards. Just what have you got to lose? Come on. 
Three more. Come on. Do it.
Paige: I don't know why I let you waste my time with this.
[Lucy gasps]
Lucy: Oh, my gosh.
Paige: Oh, what? What?

Lucy: I just got goose bumps. Do you realize these three cards are 
confirmation signs?
Paige: Of what?

Lucy: Oh, my gosh. Paige, you've been barking up the wrong tree or going down 
the wrong alley or whatever. Your journey isn't about being here with Kevin and 
having your portrait finished. Paige, this means this is about you not being all 
alone.
Paige: It can't be. How --

Lucy: I -- I don't know. I -- I don't know how. That's a question we need to 
answer. But these cards are definitely telling me that you are connected to 
somebody nearby. It all adds up.
Paige: You mean you really believe that I'm connected to someone who --
Lucy: Yeah, I do. Listen -- let me just turn over one more card, ok?
[Lucy gasps]

Lucy: Wow. That's it -- the Home card. That is the Home card. Now I would 
stake my life on it. Paige, your whole journey is meant to end here. Somehow 
it's connected to that young girl, your journey ending here, and that somebody 
is in Port Charles, nearby.
Rafe: Just put the finishing touches here and -- ta-da! What do you think?
Bernie: I don't know why it does, but it does kind of -- help me, I mean.
Alison: Oh. Good.
Sara: Thank you.

Alison: You're welcome. So as long as this barn is here, you guys will be, 
too.
Rafe: And together.
Sara: Like you guys.

Alison: Yeah, like us. So, from now on, this is our place, ok? And nobody can 
change that or take it away from us. And our hearts will always be joined 
together forever right here, ok? Ok.
Sara: Ok.
Bernie: Ok.
Rafe: All right.
Sara: I better go, huh?
Rafe: Oh. Listen, if you guys need a ride --
Bernie: No, we're ok. Thanks for everything.
Rafe: Well, I'm glad we could help.
Alison: Yeah, and good luck with you guys.
Sara: Yeah. You, too.
Alison: Ok. Oh.
Rafe: I'm already the luckiest guy I know.

Alison: Well, not half as lucky as I am because I'm right here with you in 
the place where all good dreams happen.
Alison: So, what do you think?
Rafe: I think you're a really good kisser.
Alison: Oh! You're just now noticing?
Rafe: Well, it just gets better every time.
Alison: I love you.
Rafe: I never get sick of hearing that.

Alison: Well, good. But really what I was talking about when I asked you, 
"What do you think?" -- I was talking about the kids. What do you think about --
Rafe: The kids?

Alison: Yeah. Do you think that they'll remember? Do you think that their 
hearts will stay together?
Rafe: You mean like us?
Alison: Yeah -- just like us.
Rafe: Not a doubt in my mind.
Alison: Then let's make a pact, too, ok? Our own commitment.
Rafe: For now and for all time.
Alison: Yeah.
Alison: Rafe, will you marry me?
>> On the next "Port Charles" --
Frank: Where do you think you're going?
Ricky: I'll never forgive you for this. You turned me in.
Ian: Glad you could make it.
Amy: Well, it sounded pretty important.
Ian: It's very important.
